short_description: This function uses K nearest neighbors alogrithm to classify the test points according to training points
long_description: This function uses K nearest neighbors alogrithm to classify the test points according to training points

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queenâ€™s IP saddress or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: ForceMapreduce
argument_clauses.description: Determines whether to partition the training data. The default is false The default value is false.

argument_clauses.name: K
argument_clauses.description: The number of nearest neighbors (k) to use for classifying the test data The input value must be greater than 0.

argument_clauses.name: TrainingTable
argument_clauses.description: This table holds the training data. Each record in the table represents a classified data object

argument_clauses.name: TestTable
argument_clauses.description: This table holds the test data that needs to be classified by the kNN algorithm. Each record represents a test data object

argument_clauses.name: ResponseColumn
argument_clauses.description: This column provides the class label or classification of data objects in the training table

argument_clauses.name: IdColumn
argument_clauses.description: The column in the testing table that uniquely identifies an object

argument_clauses.name: DistanceFeatures
argument_clauses.description: The columns in the training table that this function uses to compute the distance between a test object and the training objects. These columns must also be included in the testing table

argument_clauses.name: CustomizedDistance
argument_clauses.description: Defines a custom distance function ('jar_name', 'distance_class_name'). The default is Euclidean distance

argument_clauses.name: VotingWeight
argument_clauses.description: The voting weight of the distance, which must be non- negative integer. The default value is '0' The input value must be no less than 0.0. The default value is 0.0.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTable
argument_clauses.description: The name of the output table. The default is output is sent to the console
